benchmark_details.name: LONG BOX
benchmark_details.overview: LONG BOX is a collection of seven medical datasets in text-to-text format, designed to investigate model performance on long sequences, particularly for clinical tasks requiring the evaluation of long electronic health records (EHR).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of LONG BOX is to facilitate the development of long sequence handling techniques tailored to the clinical domain by providing a benchmark that investigates LLM performance on long medical texts.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: LONG BOX is currently limited in task variety as it primarily consists of different types of classification tasks.

data.source: Seven curated clinical datasets from the n2c2 NLP Research Datasets.
data.size: 85,470 samples in total across different datasets each with varied lengths
data.annotation: Annotated based on clinical notes, discharge summaries, and longitudinal records.

methods: Benchmarking with multiple large language models (LLMs)
Evaluation of long sequence handling techniques
methodology.calculation: For classification tasks, accuracy is calculated, while F1 Score is used for multi-label classification tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Lower accuracy scores indicate challenges in handling long sequences, with an overall indication of model struggle as they achieve average scores of approximately 52%.

methodology.validation: Results were validated through extensive comparison across multiple LLMs and techniques for long sequence handling.
